results.title: The Story of the pirates
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Presents a fantasy about a boy who is transported to the high seas by a magic ball. Shows how he joins with an old fisherman in foiling the attempts of a group of pirates to bury their treasure. For primary grades.

results.title: The Story of the grandfather clock
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Sam noticed that the grandfather clock had stopped. The magic ball made him very small and he went through the keyhole of the clock. There he saw people.

results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Sam is reading a story about the Wild West. He enjoys it so much, the magic ball takes him back so he can meet cowboys and indians.

results.title: Lathe: work between centres
results.creator_credit: Helmut Engelhardt, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Machine Operations Metal Work”.
Finding centres of end of stock, marking, and aligning between centres. Turning one face for reference point, rough cutting, and using automatic longitudinal feed. Knurling tools and techniques, taper turning from large to small diameter using the set-over tail-stock method.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Helmut Engelhardt, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions

results.title: Love My Way: Garden of Love
results.creator_credit: Jessica Hobbs, Fiona Seres, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Foxtel and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 10 first aired on Foxtel on 31st January 2005.
